_header: Now list Fortune thus for me to purvey
Subjects: evils of the time; complaints; Fortune, complaint against
_description: A Compleynt against Fortune, possibly by the Duke of Suffolk — four stanzas rhyme royal

BodFair16.First Lines:
Now lyst fortune thus for me to purueyeThat I ne may vn to your
                    speche attayn…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…Myn hert ys ther os yt wyl not remeueAnd so I lyue almost out
                    of byleue
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
